excerpts: The Lancelotti is probably the best ham sandwich I've ever had; I get it on sourdough.
Call in your order -
it takes them a while to make it.
Eat your sandwich while it's still hot & crunchy.
Now use the tootsie roll pop to play chase with your cat.
That's the Pop's experience.
ham sandwich.author: Jeff W.
ham sandwich.review: The Lancelotti is probably the best ham sandwich I've ever had; I get it on sourdough.  Call in your order - it takes them a while to make it.  Eat your sandwich while it's still hot & crunchy.  Now use the tootsie roll pop to play chase with your cat.  That's the Pop's experience.

excerpts: I usually get a pastrami sandwich w/ pesto sauce.
It's always nicley toasted, warm, and delicous.
Plus their sandwichs are big (I usually eat
half)The toostie pops are a nice touch too.
pastrami sandwich.author: Sesily M.
pastrami sandwich.review: When pops first opened I was slightly skepitcal but since it was close I gave it try.  It is a wonderfull spot for sandwiches of all kinds.  I usually get a pastrami sandwich w/ pesto sauce.  It's always nicley toasted, warm, and delicous.  Plus their sandwichs are big (I usually eat half)The toostie pops are a nice touch too.

excerpts: It's exactly how I like my roast beef sandwich (which I've never seen before on a menu).
Roast beef with the perfect amount of horseradish, which adds a little zip and a lot of flavor.
Lettuce, tomato, etc AND AVOCADO.
Perfection.
roast beef sandwich.author: Cliff H.
roast beef sandwich.review: The Blazing Saddles is excellent. It's exactly how I like my roast beef sandwich (which I've never seen before on a menu). Roast beef with the perfect amount of horseradish, which adds a little zip and a lot of flavor. Lettuce, tomato, etc AND AVOCADO. Perfection.

excerpts: I got a roast beef sandwich on dutch crunch.
It was really good
, I thought it was somewhat comparable to roxies with the bread.
The sandwich also came with 1/4 slice of a pickle.
I never knew pickles were so good until coming here.
Guess you'll never know what the outcome will be until you try.
They also give Tootsie Roll Pops which I thought was pretty creative because the name of the shop is Pops.
roast beef sandwich.author: Nelson G.
roast beef sandwich.review: I came here one day after taking a 4 hour test and man was I starving. I decided to try a sandwich here. I got a roast beef sandwich on dutch crunch. It was really good, I thought it was somewhat comparable to roxies with the bread. The sandwich also came with 1/4 slice of a pickle. I never knew pickles were so good until coming here. Guess you'll never know what the outcome will be until you try. They also give Tootsie Roll Pops which I thought was pretty creative because the name of the shop is Pops.

excerpts: They make a great salami sandwich.
It is a nice neighborhood place and
I can't think of a better sandwich shop in this part of town.
salami sandwich.author: Michael P.
salami sandwich.review: I eat a Pops periodically and I enjoy their sandwiches.  They make a great salami sandwich.  It is a nice neighborhood place and I can't think of a better sandwich shop in this part of town.

excerpts: My boyfriends favorite is their chicken salad sandwich (the chicken salad is homemade and fresh), my favorite is the Herb Tribute.
I love me a good Italian sandwich!!!
It's a great lunch spot, but I would recommend calling ahead to order cause they can get a little busy :)
chicken salad sandwich.author: Kimberly E.
chicken salad sandwich.review: In a city where it's all about Ike's, this sandwich shop can definitely give them a run for their money. My boyfriends favorite is their chicken salad sandwich (the chicken salad is homemade and fresh), my favorite is the Herb Tribute. I love me a good Italian sandwich!!! It's a great lunch spot, but I would recommend calling ahead to order cause they can get a little busy :)

excerpts: The employees are friendly; they informed me after I ordered my chicken salad sandwich that it will take ten minutes to make.
I did not mind since I figured they have to build (with care) and toast it.
Pop's also serves soup, simple salads and frozen yogurt.
I've been here twice
chicken salad sandwich.author: Jocelyn P.
chicken salad sandwich.review:
They make your sandwich with care. That is why there is somewhat of a wait at Pop's Sandwich Shop. Sandwiches are hefty and filled with the right amount of condiments and sauce. The chicken salad and BLT sandwiches on dutch crunch are delicious and will fill you up. When I eat their sandwiches it does not look or taste like it was thrown together in a rush with the lettuce and tomatoes falling out. It's nice to actually enjoy a well made sandwich from a local shop that is not hyped up or overrated.

The employees are friendly; they informed me after I ordered my chicken salad sandwich that it will take ten minutes to make. I did not mind since I figured they have to build (with care) and toast it. Pop's also serves soup, simple salads and frozen yogurt. I've been here twice and I plan to come back again.

*diner tip: plenty of parking! get a sandwich to go and enjoy it on a nice picnic at twin peaks or mount davidson if the weather is nice. otherwise, dining in at Pop's is also fine since the restaurant is pretty clean.

excerpts: I also had the tuna salad sandwich on dutch crunch the next day, toasted up in the oven and it was delicious.
tuna salad sandwich.author: Vanessa Z.
tuna salad sandwich.review:
I ordered through the EAT 24 App, I like that they deliver but I did not like the delivery service. The food came at the estimated delivery time, but the guy delivering my food was rude. Here's what happened, I bought two sandwiches and total came up to be $21, delivery included. At the time, I could not find my wallet and I was running around the house looking for change and when I finally had enough to pay, tips included. The delivery guy responded very rude and sarcastically.The sandwiches however was very good, I had the Free Bird with Avocado + stuffing on dutch crunch. I also had the tuna salad sandwich on dutch crunch the next day, toasted up in the oven and it was delicious.

IF!!!! you are going to try this place, skip the delivery and just come pick one up yourself and you will leave very satisfied.

excerpts: I have never loved a sandwich more than my corned beef sandwich from Pop's Sandwich Shop.
I just moved to SF
and I think my life started the minute I took a bite of this masterpiece.
From the perfect sour dough bun to the beautiful avocado.
I was in heaven.
I might have cried during and after eating the sandwich.
No man will ever make me feel like this sandwich did.
Thank you Pop.
Thank you.
I think i'm going to go broke eating your damn good sandwich.
Bless tf up
corned beef sandwich.author: Kat S.
corned beef sandwich.review: I have never loved a sandwich more than my corned beef sandwich from Pop's Sandwich Shop. I just moved to SF and I think my life started the minute I took a bite of this masterpiece. From the perfect sour dough bun to the beautiful avocado. I was in heaven. I might have cried during and after eating the sandwich. No man will ever make me feel like this sandwich did. Thank you Pop. Thank you. I think i'm going to go broke eating your damn good sandwich. Bless tf up

excerpts: I had the corned beef sandwich, my friend had the BLT and both were very tasty.
But I also have to commend them on their delivery service.
I was notified that there was a problem with my order.
They expressed their apologies and let me know a brand-new order was being made for me.
Before I knew it my order was delivered.
I will definitely order from them again.
corned beef sandwich.author: Mary A.
corned beef sandwich.review: The food was really good. I had the corned beef sandwich, my friend had the BLT and both were very tasty. But I also have to commend them on their delivery service. I was notified that there was a problem with my order. They expressed their apologies and let me know a brand-new order was being made for me. Before I knew it my order was delivered.  I will definitely order from them again.

excerpts: I especially love their meatball sandwich, The Herb Tribute!
the herb tribute.author: Tiffany U.
the herb tribute.review: The owner reached out to me to make this ordeal good again, which is much appreciated. I'm updating my original 2-star review to a 4-star review since their sandwiches are really good. I especially love their meatball sandwich, The Herb Tribute!

excerpts: Love the Herb Tribute.
Also like the lollipop pop that comes with the sandwich.
Overall for a person who doesn't care for sandwiches this place is pretty good.
the herb tribute.author: Melissa A.
the herb tribute.review: Love the Herb Tribute. Also like the lollipop pop that comes with the sandwich. Overall for a person who doesn't care for sandwiches this place is pretty good.

excerpts: I've been to several places in the city but no meatball sub can compare to The Herb Tribute.
Perfect sauce:cheese:meat:bread ratio.
I hadn't been here in a few years
so I was semi-expecting things to be different
but NO!
the herb tribute.author: Moe O.
the herb tribute.review:
I would've taken a picture of my sandwich but I couldn't resist diving in.

I've been to several places in the city but no meatball sub can compare to The Herb Tribute. Perfect sauce:cheese:meat:bread ratio. I hadn't been here in a few years so I was semi-expecting things to be different but NO! Just as delicious as I remember. 

Plenty of other delicious sandwiches to try as well and a parking lot for easy access.

excerpts: My boyfriends favorite is their chicken salad sandwich (the chicken salad is homemade and fresh), my favorite is the Herb Tribute.
I love me a good Italian sandwich!!!
It's a great lunch spot, but I would recommend calling ahead to order cause they can get a little busy :)
the herb tribute.author: Kimberly E.
the herb tribute.review: In a city where it's all about Ike's, this sandwich shop can definitely give them a run for their money. My boyfriends favorite is their chicken salad sandwich (the chicken salad is homemade and fresh), my favorite is the Herb Tribute. I love me a good Italian sandwich!!! It's a great lunch spot, but I would recommend calling ahead to order cause they can get a little busy :)

excerpts: My partner who always orders the meatball from Sub Center says The Herb Tribute has them beat.
So since we live so close I guess when the hunger for a sub strikes we'll be seeing Pop's!
Now this is dangerous....they deliver as well!
the herb tribute.author: Don O.
the herb tribute.review: So the one thing missing in the Portola Strip Mall was a sandwich shop.  You got a gourmet market, great dry cleaners, Creighton's (Mmmmm...Creighton's), a Starbucks, requisite liquor store, a horribly small Walgreen's, Round Table Pizza, Tower Burger and a mini mart that has some freakin yummy burritos and granted, the Tower Market makes some really good deli style sandwiches that are a pretty good deal, they don't make a toasted sub a la Submarine Center.  Hence, using Sub Center as the bar and the Atomic to compare to the One Flap Down, Pop's gets a solid 4 stars.  My partner who always orders the meatball from Sub Center says The Herb Tribute has them beat.  So since we live so close I guess when the hunger for a sub strikes we'll be seeing Pop's!  Now this is dangerous....they deliver as well!

excerpts: I got the politically correct which is their veggie sandwich with signature sauce.
It was quite good.
Just a little bit slow to make.
politically correct.author: Andrea F.
politically correct.review: Yummy hot toasted sandwiches. I got the politically correct which is their veggie sandwich with signature sauce. It was quite good. Just a little bit slow to make.

excerpts: Had the Hot Copa & salami on Dutch crunch while my girlfriend enjoyed "the politically correct" also on Dutch crunch.
It was delish.
All the produce tasted great and the proportion of meat to veggies to bread was perfect.
politically correct.author: Anthony F.
politically correct.review: Had the Hot Copa & salami on Dutch crunch while my girlfriend enjoyed "the politically correct" also on Dutch crunch. It was delish. All the produce tasted great and the proportion of meat to veggies to bread was perfect.

excerpts: I really enjoy the Politically Correct on a sweet roll with provolone.
politically correct.author: Arielle O.
politically correct.review:
I'm really big on sandwiches. And this little hole in the wall was a great find. They even give you a Lollipop as a dessert type of thing. By far one of my favorites.

I really enjoy the Politically Correct on a sweet roll with provolone. I love all the veggies and top it all off with some jalapeños, I'm all set.

Now I'm giving Pop's a 4star rating only because they messed up my girlfriend's sandwich today. The worker forgot to add a couple of things to spice up her sub. But it was fixed and she then enjoyed the sandwich. 

I do recommend this spot if you're looking for a good sandwich spot for decent prices.

It's also right near Twin Peaks! Good sub, great view (on clear days)..you're good to go.

excerpts: There's one vegetarian sandwich (Politically Correct).
politically correct.author: Lolia S.
politically correct.review:
I just spotted this brand new (less than a week old), old school, toasted sub shop near Tower Market in the Twin Peaks area.  Style wise, it's like Submarine Center and Gene's Liquor - toasted subs with Italian dressing (secret sauce).  The sandwiches are bigger with more filling than Submarine Center and they taste better too.  

You choose your meat and bread for the regular sandwiches ($5.47 - $6.47) or you can choose one of their specialty sandwiches.  There's one vegetarian sandwich (Politically Correct).  I tried the One Flap Down ($6.47, don't really understand the name) with turkey, salami, ham (which I omitted), American cheese, lettuce, thin tomato slices, red onions, mayo, mustard, pepperoncini and special dressing on Dutch Crunch.  Positives: Generous amount of meat, great bread, hefty sandwich.  Minor flaws: not enough veggies, especially the red onions and tomatoes, too much mustard, and it wasn't toasted long enough.  It was still cold in the center.  I'm sure they'll adjust this and increase the toasting time.  Or ask for it extra toasty.  Jalapenos are free.  You can add on soup, salad, chips, cookies and soft serve ice cream.  

The shop is bright and clean with a couple of tables.  The owner was really nice and would like to adjust his menu to reflect the preferences of the community.  I hope they have good meatballs.  3.5 stars for now but I bet that they will improve since they just opened.  I think adding more vegetarian options would be a smart move (e.g., egg salad, cheese) Credit cards accepted.

excerpts: I've always gotten the "politically correct" although I feel like a jerk ordering it.
Isn't politically correct a little pejorative?
The forced humility is worth it though because it is an awesome sandwich, with just the right balance of veggies, condiments, cheese and bread.
You know when you order a sandwich and it tastes too mustard-y or bread-y or cheesy?
That's never happened to me here.
They toast their bread well, so if you don't like that, maybe you could tell them or something.
Personally I'm a fan.
politically correct.author: Michael M.
politically correct.review:
The first time I went to Pop's I saw the owner teaching a new employee how to make a sandwich. He explained to him very patiently, "It doesn't matter if it takes you a long time to make a sandwich, as long as you get it right." That emphasis on quality really shows at Pop's. 

I've always gotten the "politically correct" although I feel like a jerk ordering it. Isn't politically correct a little pejorative? The forced humility is worth it though because it is an awesome sandwich, with just the right balance of veggies, condiments, cheese and bread. You know when you order a sandwich and it tastes too mustard-y or bread-y or cheesy? That's never happened to me here. They toast their bread well, so if you don't like that, maybe you could tell them or something. Personally I'm a fan.

excerpts: I personally love their Italian on the Sourdough roll, which is called the Lancelotti!
I love that it comes with a tootsie POP, which helps customers remember that this is called POPS!
the lancelotti.author: William H.
the lancelotti.review: Pop's has the best sandwiches in San Francisco. This family owned sandwich shop has been a SF tradition for generations. All sandwiches are made to order and toasted, so I often call ahead to reduce wait times. I personally love their Italian on the Sourdough roll, which is called the Lancelotti! I love that it comes with a tootsie POP, which helps customers remember that this is called POPS!

excerpts:
Order: 
The Lancelotti - Salami, Ham, Mortadella, Provolone, Mustard, Mayonnaise, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Pepperoncini, Aritchoke hearts and Special Dressing on Wheat roll.
And it comes with a tootsie roll lollipop!
the lancelotti.author: Jenny H.
the lancelotti.review:
I came here after my run for a quick to go lunch. A friend just moved into the area and suggested this place to try since she knows I love hot sandwiches!

Ambiance: 
It was warm inside, a few tables to sit on, cute mom & pop type shop which I love!

Order: 
The Lancelotti - Salami, Ham, Mortadella, Provolone, Mustard, Mayonnaise, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Pepperoncini, Aritchoke hearts and Special Dressing on Wheat roll. And it comes with a tootsie roll lollipop! $7.99

Set back:
15 minutes wait for a walk in order but worth all the wait! The person there did give me a heads up on the wait which was greatly appreciated. They had a big online order come in just before. I have never had a sandwich with artichoke hearts in it and it was sooo good! I loved my soft and a bit crunchy wheat roll bread. The sandwich was so big and chunky too! It was juicy and one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I was really full after devouring my entire sandwich. Worth every penny.

Yummy Sandwich! I am definitely coming back to try more!

excerpts: I've tried many subs from Pop's and my favorite is the Lancelotti.
Service is fine, but sometimes they get busy, so it takes a little longer to get your order.
(I always call ahead and pick up the order, since I'm lucky to live close by.)
But the quality of the sandwiches is what really shines.
the lancelotti.author: Dan S.
the lancelotti.review:
Pop's makes amazing subs.  I've tried many subs from Pop's and my favorite is the Lancelotti.  Service is fine, but sometimes they get busy, so it takes a little longer to get your order. (I always call ahead and pick up the order, since I'm lucky to live close by.) But the quality of the sandwiches is what really shines. I also love the Tootsie Pops in each order - nice touch!

Highly recommended if you're anywhere in the neighborhood!

excerpts: Like many people have stated, I would as well recommend the Lancelotti sandwich, it is sooo damn good.
Each time I ordered, the lady was very nice on the phone and if you previously ordered from them, they have your last order on record and ask if you would like the same thing.
Pop's has really good sandwiches and THEY DELIVER!
so you really can't complain.
the lancelotti.author: Erinn P.
the lancelotti.review:
I love this place. Signed up today just so I could write a review on it.

I live about 5 minutes away and when I'm too lazy, I just order for delivery. Like many people have stated, I would as well recommend the Lancelotti sandwich, it is sooo damn good. Each time I ordered, the lady was very nice on the phone and if you previously ordered from them, they have your last order on record and ask if you would like the same thing. Pop's has really good sandwiches and THEY DELIVER! so you really can't complain. =)

excerpts: We ordered Warren's BLT and the Lancelotti and they were both very good, especially the Lancelotti.
The sandwiches are generous, fresh, toasted, and delicious.
The delivery service was quick and painless.
We will definitely order from here again.
the lancelotti.author: Reza E.
the lancelotti.review: Very good sandwiches! We ordered Warren's BLT and the Lancelotti and they were both very good, especially the Lancelotti. The sandwiches are generous, fresh, toasted, and delicious. The delivery service was quick and painless. We will definitely order from here again.

excerpts: The Lancelotti is probably the best ham sandwich I've ever had; I get it on sourdough.
Call in your order -
it takes them a while to make it.
Eat your sandwich while it's still hot & crunchy.
Now use the tootsie roll pop to play chase with your cat.
That's the Pop's experience.
the lancelotti.author: Jeff W.
the lancelotti.review: The Lancelotti is probably the best ham sandwich I've ever had; I get it on sourdough.  Call in your order - it takes them a while to make it.  Eat your sandwich while it's still hot & crunchy.  Now use the tootsie roll pop to play chase with your cat.  That's the Pop's experience.

excerpts: I recommend The Lancelotti!
It is amazing!
The soft serve Ice Cream is yummy & refreshing!
Makes me want to get one right now!
The service is great & very friendly!
The best part is that they deliver!!!
You can get a yummy warm deli sandwich & soft serve Ice cream for delivery!  Cheers!
the lancelotti.author: Lynnet S.
the lancelotti.review: The best sandwich's in the city!  I recommend The Lancelotti!  It is amazing!   The soft serve Ice Cream is yummy & refreshing!  Makes me want to get one right now!  The service is great & very friendly!  The best part is that they deliver!!!  You can get a yummy warm deli sandwich & soft serve Ice cream for delivery!  Cheers!

excerpts: The Lancelotti Special is my all-time favorite.
As a native San Franciscan, I take my sub shops seriously.
We know the fabled debate was Marina Sub vs. Westportal Substation.
There is a clear winner now..
It's Pops!
the lancelotti.author: Kathryn P.
the lancelotti.review: Have you ever rolled over in the mid-morning and thought hmmm, I would like a delicious sandwich, but I don't really want to move?  Eventually you work up the motivation to walk to the West Portal Sub Center or the Marina Sub Center depending where you live and you get to order the crisp delicious sub you had been salvating over in your dreams.  Well now you can have it all.  Pop's is incredible and delivers.  I stumbled upon it as I was shopping at Tower market.  They toast all of the bread and have a quality of meats that far surpasses the aformentioned sub shops.  Yes they do have secret sauce.  The Lancelotti Special is my all-time favorite.  As a native San Franciscan, I take my sub shops seriously.  We know the fabled debate was Marina Sub vs. Westportal Substation.  There is a clear winner now..It's Pops!

excerpts: The bread was burnt on my Free Bird sandwich, which is a shame because that was the best one I ordered.
free bird.author: Andrew P.
free bird.review:
Just not a fan of this place.  The bread was burnt on my Free Bird sandwich, which is a shame because that was the best one I ordered.

The reuben was lackluster - not much except meat and bread.  Where was the sauerkraut?  Rye bread?  Nope.  Just wheat bread.

Delivery was prompt.  But will never be back to this place.

excerpts: At $9.45 I am especially fond of the Free Bird on Dutch Crunch (with dressing - add $0.97).
For another $0.99 I also add a small bag of chips.

My lightly toasted hot sandwich will be ready in about 10 minutes or less and come with a little surprise lollipop.
.
They can be quite busy at times

so prepare yourself for the time it may take to complete your hot sandwich. 
.
KUDOS!...
you guys are GREAT!
free bird.author: Caesar A.
free bird.review:
This wonderful neighborhood sandwich shop is in Miraloma Park. Delivery is NOT in your best interests; if at all possible just go there and pick it up.
.
At $9.45 I am especially fond of the Free Bird on Dutch Crunch (with dressing - add $0.97). For another $0.99 I also add a small bag of chips. My lightly toasted hot sandwich will be ready in about 10 minutes or less and come with a little surprise lollipop.
.
They can be quite busy at times so prepare yourself for the time it may take to complete your hot sandwich. 
.
KUDOS!...you guys are GREAT!

excerpts: My friend swore by the Blazing Saddles and Free Bird but we ended up getting the Brooklyn Bridge and Twin Peaks.
The Brooklyn Bridge was good.
Liked how they toasted the rye bread.
Pastrami yummy.
But the sandwich was a little dry.
I wonder if I could get it with the Thousand Island Dressing instead to juice it up a little?
The Twin Peaks was good too.
The avocado was nice and ripe and kept that sandwich moist.
Went great with the lettuce, tomato, pepperonci, etc salad-like topping.
free bird.author: Jean K.
free bird.review:
Peeps up in Portola should be thanking their lucky stars to have a place like Pop's in their neighborhood. Most neighborhoods don't have a local sandwich shop this good (and I've been to all the highly rated talked about ones in the city but feel free to shoot me a line if you think I've missed one!).

Better than average sandwiches. Real solid. Not sure they're worth trekking across town for - missing a wow factor. But for your local place you can't go wrong.

My friend swore by the Blazing Saddles and Free Bird but we ended up getting the Brooklyn Bridge and Twin Peaks. The Brooklyn Bridge was good. Liked how they toasted the rye bread. Pastrami yummy. But the sandwich was a little dry. I wonder if I could get it with the Thousand Island Dressing instead to juice it up a little? The Twin Peaks was good too. The avocado was nice and ripe and kept that sandwich moist. Went great with the lettuce, tomato, pepperonci, etc salad-like topping. Dutch crunch was the way to go with that one.

I'll be looking forward to visiting this neighborhood again for the Joey Bag-a-donuts.

excerpts: I ordered the free bird with avocado and stuffing on dutch crunch (as suggested by another yelper!) on eat24.
free bird.author: Ara K.
free bird.review:
I'm pretty sad about giving this place two stars because their sandwiches are really good. I ordered the free bird with avocado and stuffing on dutch crunch (as suggested by another yelper!) on eat24. Just FYI, there's a $15 minimum and $2 delivery charge. 

Anyways, the sandwich took an hour to be delivered and when it did, it was soggy and cold. On top of that, they forgot my avocado and put my sandwich on rye bread. GEE, thanks. I will say though, it's probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten.

excerpts: The sandwiches however was very good, I had the Free Bird with Avocado + stuffing on dutch crunch.
free bird.author: Vanessa Z.
free bird.review:
I ordered through the EAT 24 App, I like that they deliver but I did not like the delivery service. The food came at the estimated delivery time, but the guy delivering my food was rude. Here's what happened, I bought two sandwiches and total came up to be $21, delivery included. At the time, I could not find my wallet and I was running around the house looking for change and when I finally had enough to pay, tips included. The delivery guy responded very rude and sarcastically.The sandwiches however was very good, I had the Free Bird with Avocado + stuffing on dutch crunch. I also had the tuna salad sandwich on dutch crunch the next day, toasted up in the oven and it was delicious.

IF!!!! you are going to try this place, skip the delivery and just come pick one up yourself and you will leave very satisfied.

excerpts: I love the free bird, I get it almost every time.
An amazing sandwich.
free bird.author: Chris D.
free bird.review:
I think this place has some of the best sandwiches in SF. A friend helped me discover it. And I have been going back ever since. 

I love the free bird, I get it almost every time. An amazing sandwich. It is also way reasonably priced for a sandwich shop in the city.

Whenever I go here, the people are friendly and my sandwich, although I call ahead, is always ready in 15 minutes or so. I have never had to wait a long time to get my grub.

They also have a system that remembers what you ordered the last time you ordered. So if you are a creature of habit, like myself, it's super convenient.

And they give you a tootsie pop for dessert with your sandwich. I always love something a little sweet after lunch.

I come here weekly and so should you. Great sandwich shop, don't pass it up!

excerpts: I personally love the 'Free Bird!!!'
free bird.author: Nathan A.
free bird.review:
Transplants and visiting humans all ask the same multi-million dollar question.

How do you financially SURVIVE in San Francisco?!? 

Often in a look that tells you their soul has been shaken by the absurd prices that seem to dominant our city.

The answer to this my friend is very complicated but I am willing to share with you the secret key to success!!!


The answer is Burritos & Sandwiches.

Yes well priced and high value sandwiches and burritos will reduce the bleeding to your wallet during your journey to ultimate happiness in possibly the best city ever.

Pops seems to make my list of sandwich places that are worth it.

Good amount of meat, interesting variety of flavors, good bread, and a rewards system.

I personally love the 'Free Bird!!!' 

Turkey, Avocado and Cranberry sauce. I nearly fainted by the strength of that mouth orgasm.

Go my friends and share the secret so that those places charging $10-$100 for a burrito or sandwich can eventually die and rational pricing of food can return.

7.99 + Tax ( 0.70) Total of $8.69

excerpts: Love the Free Bird, Twin Peaks, and STM Bronco sandwiches.
free bird.author: Julie N.
free bird.review:
Great sandwiches, easy parking with a large metered lot out front. Love the Free Bird, Twin Peaks, and STM Bronco sandwiches. All sandwiches come nicely toasted with a tootsie roll pop on the side. 

We typically order our sandwiches for pick up since we live pretty close and find it's better to order in advance by phone or online and then pick them up. They are a small operation and it can take some time to make everything if you order in the shop and wait there for it since they have many call in / online orders going at the same time. The employees clearly are working hard and are very friendly though so I enjoy supporting this local business.

excerpts: First time I got a Free Bird, the second time I got a Wharf.
Both were incredible!
Very fresh and were exactly what I was wanting.
The customer service is also very nice and employees look like they are working hard.
I plan on stopping by there whenever I'm in the area.
free bird.author: Tyler B.
free bird.review: Pop's is my new favorite sandwich shop on this side of the city. My work sometimes takes me to a few job sites nearby and I have gone to Pop's twice in a row now. First time I got a Free Bird, the second time I got a Wharf. Both were incredible! Very fresh and were exactly what I was wanting. The customer service is also very nice and employees look like they are working hard. I plan on stopping by there whenever I'm in the area.

excerpts: Ordered the free bird with stuffing on Dutch crunch.
Had to order two for the minimum delivery and it ended up being 22 plus tip.
Arrived after an hour soggy, cold, and without stuffing (which I was charged for anyway).
The sandwiches are good but when you wait so long for a nearby sandwich shop and pay that much, it should be correct.
It's not that hard to get an order right ...
If you offer stuffing on it
and I order it, how easy would it have been to get it right?
Wouldn't order delivery again based on price and mistakes and quality of arrival.

excerpts: Not knowing what to order, I just went off of the other reviewers and got the Free Bird - turkey, bacon, cranberry sauce, lettuce...and stuffing.
Basically a Thanksgiving dinner packed into a sandwich.
free bird.author: Brandon Y.
free bird.review:
Not knowing where to eat on a Sunday afternoon, drove up to Twin Peaks and discovered this cute sandwich shop courtesy of yelp.

Not knowing what to order, I just went off of the other reviewers and got the Free Bird - turkey, bacon, cranberry sauce, lettuce...and stuffing. Basically a Thanksgiving dinner packed into a sandwich. I ordered and I guess they must have been busy because it took a good 15-20 mins before I got my to-go order...

Once I bit into the sandwich however, it was well worth the wait. Not only was I surprised by the crisp bacon, but the cranberry sauce was welcomed quite warmly with its not-overly fruity taste. The dutch crunch was toasted just right too so that the sandwich was not soggy like some other SF sandwich shops.

I will definitely have to come back here and taste some of their other creative menu items

excerpts: My favorite sandwich has to be the "Free Bird"!!
free bird.author: Yvonne P.
free bird.review: LOVE POPS!  All of the sandwiches I have tried are wonderful.  I would put a cautionary on the "Blazing Saddle" sandwich.  They are very generous with the horse radish and it can be a little overwhelming.  My favorite sandwich has to be the "Free Bird"!!

excerpts: My friend decided to split the Free Bird on dutch crutch and may I say....
IT WAS
SO GOOD!!!
But any who, I will most definitely be back again, whether to get the Free Bird again or try the other specialty sandwiches!
I've already suggested my other friends who've never been here before to try it out also!
free bird.author: Athena W.
free bird.review:
I went out with a friend for a lunch date to catch up and she suggested to go to Pops. I've never been there before so I figured what the heck, I'll give this place a try. They had a variety of regular and specialty sandwiches. There was a few choices of what kind of bread we wanted, which was a bonus! My friend decided to split the Free Bird on dutch crutch and may I say.... IT WAS SO GOOD!!! Exactly like a thanksgiving feast on a sandwich! 

I see there are some reviews that complained about the bad service they had there, but I experienced no difficulties there. The workers were having fun doing their job. Maybe it was cause my friend and I went right before the SOTA kids were out for lunch? But any who, I will most definitely be back again, whether to get the Free Bird again or try the other specialty sandwiches! I've already suggested my other friends who've never been here before to try it out also!

excerpts: Free Bird is my go-to!

free bird.review: Always tasty food, super nice people and usually has my food ready by the quoted time!  Free Bird is my go-to!

excerpts: The free bird is the best thanksgiving style sandwich I have ever had.
Good bread, delicious meats and a nice array of extras.
Def ordering again

free bird.review: Sandwiches were absolutely delicious. I live abou twenty minutes away and recieved my delivery order within the hour--quick enough that my sandwiches did not get cold or soggy. The free bird is the best thanksgiving style sandwich I have ever had. Good bread, delicious meats and a nice array of extras. Def ordering again

excerpts: The "Free Bird" is a Thanksgiving Dinner in a

Every time I go to Pops

Great Sandwich......The "Free Bird" is a Thanksgiving Dinner in a  Bun........ Awesome!!  
Every time I go to Pops I say to my self, I'll try a different sandwich but I can't help it and I order a "Free Bird". Best sandwich around. Oh and no better way to finish lunch than with a Tootsie Roll Pop.

excerpts: I had only tried the Free Bird without stuffing a few times, and thought it was delicious.
By accident, I ordered one with stuffing as it's suggested on the menu.
It may be the best mistake I've ever made.
I cannot order anything else.
It truly is Thanksgiving in a bun.

free bird.review: Great little sandwich shop.  I had only tried the Free Bird without stuffing a few times, and thought it was delicious. excerpts: I can't get enough of the Free Bird.
I too try to talk myself into ordering a different one, but can never do it.
This bird you can not change.
Lord knows I can't change.
free bird.author: Lucy P.
free bird.review: I don't understand the bad reviews.  The sandwiches are great and the people who work there have always been friendly to me.  I call ahead with my order and the ten minutes it takes for me to drive over is plenty of time for them to make my sandwich.  I'm with Frank H.  I can't get enough of the Free Bird.  I too try to talk myself into ordering a different one, but can never do it.  This bird you can not change.  Lord knows I can't change.

excerpts: Our favorites are the twin peaks and the free bird!  DELICIOUS!
free bird.author: Elizabeth R.
free bird.review: This sandwich shop has delicious and original sandwiches! Service can be a tad slow but they are always friendly. Our favorites are the twin peaks and the free bird!  DELICIOUS!

excerpts: I followed fellow Yelpers on their review of "free bird".
One of the review was right, its a Thanksgiving feast on a sandwich.
I got it on a dutch crunch.
One advice,  pay extra for the stuffing.
And I got a tootsie roll pop inside the bag.
Pretty nice touch eh!
free bird.author: roderick s.
free bird.review: I followed fellow Yelpers on their review of "free bird". One of the review was right, its a Thanksgiving feast on a sandwich. I got it on a dutch crunch. One advice,  pay extra for the stuffing. And I got a tootsie roll pop inside the bag. Pretty nice touch eh!

excerpts: Except for the one time I ordered the free bird..and it came with an avocado instead of stuffing ughhhh disgusting...but think there was just a misunderstanding when ordering, and am biased towards avocados...
free bird.author: KatieRae A.
free bird.review: Best sub shop in San francisco so far!!! Being from minnesota...there are amazing sandwich shops that can't compare to any of these delis. I even find myself wandering to subway just to try and get a taste of home, and they suck out here. Ingredients aren't fresh...stale bread, whats the point. Pops is always delicious. Except for the one time I ordered the free bird..and it came with an avocado instead of stuffing ughhhh disgusting...but think there was just a misunderstanding when ordering, and am biased towards avocados...

excerpts: And my new favorite is the Free Bird..
free bird.author: Renee F.
free bird.review:
Awesome sandwiches!! My favorite is the Herb with jalepenos on sourdough - sooOoOo yummy!! And my new favorite is the Free Bird..I love Thanksgiving dinner and that's what it makes me think of :)

The price is good compared to other delis...and they really take the time to carefully make it and toast it just right...

The staff is also very friendly...I just highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice, hearty sandwich!

OOooOOoh man I'm totally craving one right now!!!

excerpts: that rather than eating my sandwich on my lunch break, then coming back and wasting time at work by yelping, I stopped half way through my "Free Bird Sandwich" to write this review.
free bird.author: Matt C.
free bird.review:
I've taken a short-term job in the mountain range that protects the vibrancy of the Castro from whatever-ness of the Sunset, otherwise known as Twin Peaks. And while Twin Peaks is known for its fabulous views, it should really be known for being the home to Pop's Sandwich Shop.

Pop's is hands down one of the top three sandwich shops in the city. Not only do they have your standard sandwiches, they also have specialties, like turkey and cranberry, or an avocado club. Also the quality is way better than "that sub place" on West Portal, and the environment and staff are much more pleasant than "that creepy dark place" two blocks down.

Plus, they price everything so that after tax it always comes out to a "round" number, like $7 even, or $6.50.

Plus Plus, they give you a free tootsie roll pop.

Pop's is so great that rather than eating my sandwich on my lunch break, then coming back and wasting time at work by yelping, I stopped half way through my "Free Bird Sandwich" to write this review.

excerpts: I also tried their "free bird", which was okay...
but I imagine it would have what it takes if I didn't forget to order it with stuffing on it.
I must not fail to mention that their potato salad is to die for.
I personally hate potato salad, but their recipe is so delicious I am almost tempted to ask them how they make it so damn good.
free bird.author: Katie S.
free bird.review: Pop's is AMAZING. Not only are their sandwiches fantastic, but they deliver almost anywhere in San Francisco, including the Sunset. I cannot give them enough brownie points for that! They also almost always have a buy-one-get-one-free deal circulating, which makes it very affordable as well. You can pretty much get 2 sandwiches for $10 or less. I have tried the Twin Peaks sandwich, and it one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I also tried their "free bird", which was okay... but I imagine it would have what it takes if I didn't forget to order it with stuffing on it. I must not fail to mention that their potato salad is to die for. I personally hate potato salad, but their recipe is so delicious I am almost tempted to ask them how they make it so damn good.

excerpts: The free bird is also amazing, it tastes like thanksgiving dinner each bite.
If u eat the sandwiches at the shop you get a pickle on the side which is a nice addition to the sandwich.
You also get a lollipop which is surprisingly nice after eating a sandwich.
Good people working there always nice and such....
GO
2 POPS its AMAZING
free bird.author: Mike F.
free bird.review: I have been 2 pops almost every weekend for the past couple months and there is ALWAYS parking no matter what time of day. The Sandwiches are decently priced and taste AMAZING...I usually go with turkey on sourdough with everything +jalepenos which are free 2 add on. The free bird is also amazing, it tastes like thanksgiving dinner each bite. If u eat the sandwiches at the shop you get a pickle on the side which is a nice addition to the sandwich. You also get a lollipop which is surprisingly nice after eating a sandwich. Good people working there always nice and such....GO 2 POPS its AMAZING

excerpts: I love the Wharf (like a tuna melt plus plus)
I recently tried the new chicken pesto at Maria's suggestion...
I can't wait for Monday
so I can go back for another one!
the wharf.author: gayle p.
the wharf.review: I love, love, love Pop's! Yummy, delicious flavors, fresh ingredients and the folks who make the food are always darling.  I love the Wharf (like a tuna melt plus plus)  I recently tried the new chicken pesto at Maria's suggestion...I can't wait for Monday so I can go back for another one!

excerpts: Twin Peaks sandwich was good and so was the Pastrami.
delivery was quick enough!
always be patient with delivery.
twin peaks.author: Tracy L.
twin peaks.review:
got delivery. this was yummy! Twin Peaks sandwich was good and so was the Pastrami.
delivery was quick enough! always be patient with delivery.

excerpts: Then comes Twin Peaks.
twin peaks.author: Dara S.
twin peaks.review:
I have recently had this obsession with deli like sandwiches. And Pop's has made it to the top of the list. I'm so thankful that this shop is in my beloved city and I can eat it weekly (AHA!). 

Pop's has definitely perfected their sandwich. One Flap Down is my ultimate favorite. Then comes Twin Peaks. I have yet to try them all, but I wouldn't doubt their deliciousness. 

I wish they could stay open a little later since I tend to eat a late dinner.

excerpts: My friend swore by the Blazing Saddles and Free Bird but we ended up getting the Brooklyn Bridge and Twin Peaks.
The Brooklyn Bridge was good.
Liked how they toasted the rye bread.
Pastrami yummy.
But the sandwich was a little dry.
I wonder if I could get it with the Thousand Island Dressing instead to juice it up a little?
The Twin Peaks was good too.
The avocado was nice and ripe and kept that sandwich moist.
Went great with the lettuce, tomato, pepperonci, etc salad-like topping.
twin peaks.author: Jean K.
twin peaks.review:
Peeps up in Portola should be thanking their lucky stars to have a place like Pop's in their neighborhood. Most neighborhoods don't have a local sandwich shop this good (and I've been to all the highly rated talked about ones in the city but feel free to shoot me a line if you think I've missed one!).

Better than average sandwiches. Real solid. Not sure they're worth trekking across town for - missing a wow factor. But for your local place you can't go wrong.

My friend swore by the Blazing Saddles and Free Bird but we ended up getting the Brooklyn Bridge and Twin Peaks. The Brooklyn Bridge was good. Liked how they toasted the rye bread. Pastrami yummy. But the sandwich was a little dry. I wonder if I could get it with the Thousand Island Dressing instead to juice it up a little? The Twin Peaks was good too. The avocado was nice and ripe and kept that sandwich moist. Went great with the lettuce, tomato, pepperonci, etc salad-like topping. Dutch crunch was the way to go with that one.

I'll be looking forward to visiting this neighborhood again for the Joey Bag-a-donuts.

excerpts: The customer service was good and so was the twin peaks that ashley made for me.
It was like it was made from love.
Anyone that's looking to get there sandwich fix needs to come here
twin peaks.author: Ryan S.
twin peaks.review: This place absolutely smacks. I'd come here anytime and their sandwiches will still be bomb. The customer service was good and so was the twin peaks that ashley made for me. It was like it was made from love. Anyone that's looking to get there sandwich fix needs to come here

excerpts: Love the Free Bird, Twin Peaks, and STM Bronco sandwiches.
twin peaks.author: Julie N.
twin peaks.review:
Great sandwiches, easy parking with a large metered lot out front. Love the Free Bird, Twin Peaks, and STM Bronco sandwiches. All sandwiches come nicely toasted with a tootsie roll pop on the side. 

We typically order our sandwiches for pick up since we live pretty close and find it's better to order in advance by phone or online and then pick them up. They are a small operation and it can take some time to make everything if you order in the shop and wait there for it since they have many call in / online orders going at the same time. The employees clearly are working hard and are very friendly though so I enjoy supporting this local business.

Once I bit into the sandwich however, it was well worth the wait. Not only was I surprised by the crisp bacon, but the cranberry sauce was welcomed quite warmly with its not-overly fruity taste. The dutch crunch was toasted just right too so that the sandwich was not soggy like some other SF sandwich shops.

I will definitely have to come back here and taste some of their other creative menu items

No discount, or sincere apology.
screw this place, not giving them my business after this.

excerpts: Feelin' Hot-Hot-Hot and Twin Peaks are my go-tos, but there's tasty stuff up and down the menu.
twin peaks.author: George J.
twin peaks.review: Consistently delicious classic deli sandwiches, from very nice people. A neighborhood staple. Feelin' Hot-Hot-Hot and Twin Peaks are my go-tos, but there's tasty stuff up and down the menu.

excerpts: I really like the twin peaks.
Great value, great tasting sandwiches.
A sandwich of this size and quality would cost you at least $5 more anywhere else.
friendly staff
, they take a little while, but its worth it.
twin peaks.author: Yoli B.
twin peaks.review: The best sandwich spot in SF. I really like the twin peaks. Great value, great tasting sandwiches. A sandwich of this size and quality would cost you at least $5 more anywhere else.  friendly staff, they take a little while, but its worth it.

excerpts: Love love love the twin peaks sandwich.
The flavor and care that they put into every order has definitely made this place my go to sandwich shop in the neighborhood!
They keep it fun with a tootsie pop with every order!
twin peaks.author: Ryan G.
twin peaks.review: Love love love the twin peaks sandwich. The flavor and care that they put into every order has definitely made this place my go to sandwich shop in the neighborhood! They keep it fun with a tootsie pop with every order!

excerpts: It's also right near Twin Peaks!
Good sub, great view (on clear
days)
you're good to go.
twin peaks.author: Arielle O.
twin peaks.review:
I'm really big on sandwiches. And this little hole in the wall was a great find. They even give you a Lollipop as a dessert type of thing. By far one of my favorites.

I really enjoy the Politically Correct on a sweet roll with provolone. I love all the veggies and top it all off with some jalapeños, I'm all set.

Now I'm giving Pop's a 4star rating only because they messed up my girlfriend's sandwich today. The worker forgot to add a couple of things to spice up her sub. But it was fixed and she then enjoyed the sandwich. 

I do recommend this spot if you're looking for a good sandwich spot for decent prices.

It's also right near Twin Peaks! Good sub, great view (on clear days)..you're good to go.

excerpts: Try their Twin Peaks sub though - as well as their other specials.
twin peaks.author: Susan Y.
twin peaks.review:
Good quality subs in my neighborhood is always nice.

^______________^ I like that they include a lollipop with a sub order - it makes me feel 5 years old again after I eat my sub. Hehe.

You can choose the type of bread you like, similar to most sub places but the fact that this place is a Mom and Pop's shop - adds a little home to the sub. 

Their prices are what you normally expect from a sub place nowadays - better quality than subways I would say - and it feels more personal when you order from here. lol.

Anything with cheese here is a go in my book. Teehee. 

Try their Twin Peaks sub though - as well as their other specials. (:

excerpts: Hands down, Twin Peaks is my favorite!
On dutch crunch + pesto sauce!
It has the bacon, the avocoado, ham, turkey, and other usual veggies!
A sandwich + a tootsie pop all for $7!
twin peaks.author: Lianne D.
twin peaks.review: Hands down, Twin Peaks is my favorite! On dutch crunch + pesto sauce! It has the bacon, the avocoado, ham, turkey, and other usual veggies! A sandwich + a tootsie pop all for $7!

excerpts: Get the 'Twin Peaks' sandwich, it's to die for.
Also, every time I've been in the service has been EXCELLENT.
Very light-hearted, hard-working folks.
twin peaks.author: Jacob N.
twin peaks.review: Best sandwiches in San Francisco. That's right, I said it. Get the 'Twin Peaks' sandwich, it's to die for. Also, every time I've been in the service has been EXCELLENT. Very light-hearted, hard-working folks.

excerpts: The Twin Peaks and One Flap
Down on a french roll are very good.
Toasted, very flavorful and rather large sammies.
twin peaks.author: Lesliegh H.
twin peaks.review:
Great find! Less than 5 mins away from my place, and satisfies my sandwich craving.  The Twin Peaks and One Flap Down on a french roll are very good.  Toasted, very flavorful and rather large sammies.  Have to try other specialty sandwiches off the menu!

The girls behind the counter were friendly and fast at making sandwiches, considering they were taking phone orders too.

excerpts: Got the twin peaks and damn was it good!
Ham, turkey, bacon, avocado and easily the best dutch crunch I've ever had.
It all starts with the bread on a sandwich for me and this was spot on.
Phenomenal sandwich, I'll be coming back very soon!
twin peaks.author: Jonah G.
twin peaks.review: Driven past this little hole in the wall dozens of times and finally came in due to a friends recommendation. Got the twin peaks and damn was it good! Ham, turkey, bacon, avocado and easily the best dutch crunch I've ever had. It all starts with the bread on a sandwich for me and this was spot on. Phenomenal sandwich, I'll be coming back very soon!

excerpts: I just spotted this brand new (less than a week old), old school, toasted sub shop near Tower Market in the Twin Peaks area.
Style wise, it's like Submarine Center and Gene's Liquor - toasted subs with Italian dressing (secret sauce).
twin peaks.author: Lolia S.
twin peaks.review:
I just spotted this brand new (less than a week old), old school, toasted sub shop near Tower Market in the Twin Peaks area.  Style wise, it's like Submarine Center and Gene's Liquor - toasted subs with Italian dressing (secret sauce).  The sandwiches are bigger with more filling than Submarine Center and they taste better too.  

You choose your meat and bread for the regular sandwiches ($5.47 - $6.47) or you can choose one of their specialty sandwiches.  There's one vegetarian sandwich (Politically Correct).  I tried the One Flap Down ($6.47, don't really understand the name) with turkey, salami, ham (which I omitted), American cheese, lettuce, thin tomato slices, red onions, mayo, mustard, pepperoncini and special dressing on Dutch Crunch.  Positives: Generous amount of meat, great bread, hefty sandwich.  Minor flaws: not enough veggies, especially the red onions and tomatoes, too much mustard, and it wasn't toasted long enough.  It was still cold in the center.  I'm sure they'll adjust this and increase the toasting time.  Or ask for it extra toasty.  Jalapenos are free.  You can add on soup, salad, chips, cookies and soft serve ice cream.  

The shop is bright and clean with a couple of tables.  The owner was really nice and would like to adjust his menu to reflect the preferences of the community.  I hope they have good meatballs.  3.5 stars for now but I bet that they will improve since they just opened.  I think adding more vegetarian options would be a smart move (e.g., egg salad, cheese) Credit cards accepted.

excerpts: They don't seem to have a signature sandwich, so I went with the Twin Peaks, which more or less has the works.
Not bad, but it's not going to unseat Roxie's.
And as for quick bites on this block, Miraloma Market's burritos are still #1.
But Pop's is a welcome addition--we've actually got a decent spectrum of food choices here now.
twin peaks.author: Wes M.
twin peaks.review:
I walked past Pop's for months, waiting for it to open, determined to be the first to review it, but somehow I missed opening day and Lolia beat me to the punch.  Oh well, can't win em all.  Actually, it's sort of tough to make it here as they're only open 10-6 on weekdays, exactly the hours I'm not around.  So I had to wait for a chance to come by on the weekend.

It's basically your typical shoebox with a few tables, although the living-room(?) balcony in the back is a twist.  Too bad you can't sit up there.  They don't seem to have a signature sandwich, so I went with the Twin Peaks, which more or less has the works.  Not bad, but it's not going to unseat Roxie's.  And as for quick bites on this block, Miraloma Market's burritos are still #1.  But Pop's is a welcome addition--we've actually got a decent spectrum of food choices here now.

excerpts: get a sandwich to go and enjoy it on a nice picnic at twin peaks or mount davidson if the weather is nice.
otherwise, dining in at Pop's is also fine since the restaurant is pretty clean.
twin peaks.author: Jocelyn P.
twin peaks.review:
They make your sandwich with care. That is why there is somewhat of a wait at Pop's Sandwich Shop. Sandwiches are hefty and filled with the right amount of condiments and sauce. The chicken salad and BLT sandwiches on dutch crunch are delicious and will fill you up. When I eat their sandwiches it does not look or taste like it was thrown together in a rush with the lettuce and tomatoes falling out. It's nice to actually enjoy a well made sandwich from a local shop that is not hyped up or overrated.

The employees are friendly; they informed me after I ordered my chicken salad sandwich that it will take ten minutes to make. I did not mind since I figured they have to build (with care) and toast it. Pop's also serves soup, simple salads and frozen yogurt. I've been here twice and I plan to come back again.

*diner tip: plenty of parking! get a sandwich to go and enjoy it on a nice picnic at twin peaks or mount davidson if the weather is nice. otherwise, dining in at Pop's is also fine since the restaurant is pretty clean.

excerpts: Ordered the Twin Peaks on wheat roll, friend had "the GEM" (not on the website, but it's eggplant marinara sandwich) and both were so delicious.
BIG sandwich (no "small or large" bs), nicely toasted, warm meat, perfect amount of avocado... ahhhhhhhhh.
Yum.
$7 bucks total.
NiCE.
twin peaks.author: Christine Y.
twin peaks.review:
I happen to be sifting through the Valupak coupons (once a year occurrence) and saw a BOGO coupon for this place. I looked on Yelp and saw that it had decent reviews so I thought I'd go ahead and try it.

Ordered the Twin Peaks on wheat roll, friend had "the GEM" (not on the website, but it's eggplant marinara sandwich) and both were so delicious. BIG sandwich (no "small or large" bs), nicely toasted, warm meat, perfect amount of avocado... ahhhhhhhhh. Yum. $7 bucks total. NiCE. Cheap. 

We were the only ones there at 10am but they were catering an event (tons of sandwiches in big bags all over) so we did sort of wait a few minutes but the sandwich was totally worth it and staff was very friendly. 

I'm over sub center and their chaotic disorganized craziness and over-hyped salad dressing (although the three amigos are SO nice). Give this place a shot.  

Parking lot in front with meters.

excerpts: I decided to get the Twin Peaks special on wheat bread.
I was pretty happy with the results.
Portions-wise
, it was great.
Meat was fresh and good use of condiments.
Plus, they throw in a tootsie roll lollipop.
It was a bit expensive, coming close to $9
twin peaks.author: Jonathan L.
twin peaks.review:
I lived so close by this place that I decided it was worth checking out one day. It definitely had a "mom and pop" shop type of feeling and at the moment was run by two younger people, looking like they just came out of college. They were pretty laid back and friendly. I decided to get the Twin Peaks special on wheat bread. I was pretty happy with the results. Portions-wise, it was great. Meat was fresh and good use of condiments. Plus, they throw in a tootsie roll lollipop. It was a bit expensive, coming close to $9 but most of the food in the area isn't cheap. 

The wait was a bit long (~15 minutes) and considering there was only one guy in front of me, I think they could've done a quicker job. One nice thing they offer is if you buy 10 sandwiches, you get the next one free. I'm not sure I'll be back that often but it's nice to know it's there.

In general, this place is nice. Food is good. Wait is terrible. Who knows how long you have to wait for food during a lunch hour rush. If I don't feel like driving to Roxie's, it's actually worth the walk/bike ride over here. 4 stars.

excerpts: Our favorites are the twin peaks and the free bird!  DELICIOUS!
twin peaks.author: Elizabeth R.
twin peaks.review: This sandwich shop has delicious and original sandwiches! Service can be a tad slow but they are always friendly. Our favorites are the twin peaks and the free bird!  DELICIOUS!

excerpts: It's near our Twin Peaks place.
Drove by it so many times, but never stopped in.
Finally came here on Saturday.
twin peaks.author: Jen D.
twin peaks.review:
This place is AWESOME. It's near our Twin Peaks place. Drove by it so many times, but never stopped in. Finally came here on Saturday. Good choice. 

I went with the meatball hoagie. The meatballs were so moist and flavorful. The tomato sauce was also very flavorful. All topped with really good provolone cheese, toasted on sourdough. REALLY REALLY good sandwich. I've found my favorite meatball hoagie in SF. Hands down.

excerpts: I've taken a short-term job in the mountain range that protects the vibrancy of the Castro from whatever-ness of the Sunset, otherwise known as Twin Peaks.
And while Twin Peaks is known for its fabulous views, it should really be known for being the home to Pop's Sandwich Shop.
twin peaks.author: Matt C.
twin peaks.review:
I've taken a short-term job in the mountain range that protects the vibrancy of the Castro from whatever-ness of the Sunset, otherwise known as Twin Peaks. And while Twin Peaks is known for its fabulous views, it should really be known for being the home to Pop's Sandwich Shop.

Pop's is hands down one of the top three sandwich shops in the city. Not only do they have your standard sandwiches, they also have specialties, like turkey and cranberry, or an avocado club. Also the quality is way better than "that sub place" on West Portal, and the environment and staff are much more pleasant than "that creepy dark place" two blocks down.

Plus, they price everything so that after tax it always comes out to a "round" number, like $7 even, or $6.50.

Plus Plus, they give you a free tootsie roll pop.

Pop's is so great that rather than eating my sandwich on my lunch break, then coming back and wasting time at work by yelping, I stopped half way through my "Free Bird Sandwich" to write this review.

excerpts: Love the twin peaks.
Make sure you request your pickle if you order to go.
twin peaks.author: M R.
twin peaks.review: Love the twin peaks. Make sure you request your pickle if you order to go.

excerpts: Twin Peaks and a bottle of Coke - 7.47+tax
twin peaks.author: Matt A.
twin peaks.review:
I saw ads for Pop's at a USF basketball game, so my friend and I decided to check it out.  Their sandwiches are toasted and are pretty big with a generous amount of meat.  The special sauce is the same old Italian dressing like concoction, but it's still good.  The owner is a cool dude.  Pop's may have trouble getting business from Sub Center, but their prices are cheaper and the store is far less crowded.

Twin Peaks and a bottle of Coke - 7.47+tax

excerpts: I have tried the Twin Peaks sandwich, and
it one of the best sandwiches I've ever had.
twin peaks.author: Katie S.
twin peaks.review: Pop's is AMAZING. Not only are their sandwiches fantastic, but they deliver almost anywhere in San Francisco, including the Sunset. I cannot give them enough brownie points for that! They also almost always have a buy-one-get-one-free deal circulating, which makes it very affordable as well. You can pretty much get 2 sandwiches for $10 or less. I have tried the Twin Peaks sandwich, and it one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I also tried their "free bird", which was okay... but I imagine it would have what it takes if I didn't forget to order it with stuffing on it. I must not fail to mention that their potato salad is to die for. I personally hate potato salad, but their recipe is so delicious I am almost tempted to ask them how they make it so damn good.

excerpts: I had the Twin Peaks sandwich on rye
and I was pleasantly surprised.
The sauces were really tasty and prevented the sandwich from being too dry, but it wasn't soggy either.
The sandwich was good size for lunch.
twin peaks.author: Adore P.
twin peaks.review:
I had the Twin Peaks sandwich on rye and I was pleasantly surprised. The sauces were really tasty and prevented the sandwich from being too dry, but it wasn't soggy either. The sandwich was good size for lunch. I also got the small macaroni side salad and it was tasty as well.

It was pretty busy when I got there around 1245pm. Next time I'll try to avoid the regular lunch hour, especially now that school has started. However, even though they were busy I got my sandwich pretty quickly in 10-15 minutes.

I'm definitely going again.

excerpts: One Flap Down is my ultimate favorite.
one flap down.author: Dara S.
one flap down.review:
I have recently had this obsession with deli like sandwiches. And Pop's has made it to the top of the list. I'm so thankful that this shop is in my beloved city and I can eat it weekly (AHA!). 

Pop's has definitely perfected their sandwich. One Flap Down is my ultimate favorite. Then comes Twin Peaks. I have yet to try them all, but I wouldn't doubt their deliciousness. 

I wish they could stay open a little later since I tend to eat a late dinner.

excerpts: One Flap Down is my go to
one flap down.author: Mike F.
one flap down.review:
I haven't posted a review in years, but seeing the 1 and 2 star ratings makes me shake my head in anger for such a quality business.  I'm a HUGE sandwich guy and Pop's sandwiches are some of the best around, hands down!  I used to go to Subs in West Portal on a weekly basis, but this is now my regular spot.  Whether I'm bringing it home, eating in the car, or taking it to the game, it's always what I expect.  One Flap Down is my go to but you really can't go wrong with any of the other sandwiches.

As for people posting bad reviews based on delivery.  You obviously don't cherish the integrity of your sandwich much do you?  Every employee works extremely hard here with the amount of foot traffic they see, so listening to complaints over the phone is probably a little tough for how busy they are.  Before all these food delivery services even existed, you might not have had the luxury of even having a Pops sandwich delivered to your door.  Take it for what it is at that point, or get off your butt and pick it up hot and fresh.  Come in to the store and you'll see how good these sandwiches really are and how great the staff is.

Keep it up Pops!!!  See you this afternoon!

excerpts: I love their meatball and their One Flap down the best.
The bread is always fresh and the aroma alone is worth coming in here for.
one flap down.author: Brian S.
one flap down.review:
Ohhhhhhh PAPI!!! Ohhhhh PAPI!!!

Yes, I call out the restaurant's name as I enjoy one of their delicious and warm subs.  Big deal.  Don't judge me. :)

The sandwiches are THAT good.  I love their meatball and their One Flap down the best. The bread is always fresh and the aroma alone is worth coming in here for.  Haaaaaa

Order from home if you are coming to pick one up though. They get a lot of take out business and you could wait 10-15min for your sandwich if you just pop in. 

I like how they bag it up too. Napkins and a Tootsie Pop.  Can't beat the prices too :)

excerpts: I tried the One Flap Down ($6.47,

don't really understand the name) with turkey, salami, ham (which I omitted), American cheese, lettuce, thin tomato slices, red onions, mayo, mustard, pepperoncini and special dressing on Dutch Crunch.
Positives: Generous amount of meat, great bread, hefty sandwich.
Minor flaws: not enough veggies, especially the red onions and tomatoes, too much mustard, and it wasn't toasted long enough.
It was still cold in the center.
I'm sure they'll adjust this and increase the toasting time.
Or ask for it extra toasty.
Jalapenos are free.
one flap down.author: Lolia S.
one flap down.review:
I just spotted this brand new (less than a week old), old school, toasted sub shop near Tower Market in the Twin Peaks area.  Style wise, it's like Submarine Center and Gene's Liquor - toasted subs with Italian dressing (secret sauce).  The sandwiches are bigger with more filling than Submarine Center and they taste better too.  

You choose your meat and bread for the regular sandwiches ($5.47 - $6.47) or you can choose one of their specialty sandwiches.  There's one vegetarian sandwich (Politically Correct).  I tried the One Flap Down ($6.47, don't really understand the name) with turkey, salami, ham (which I omitted), American cheese, lettuce, thin tomato slices, red onions, mayo, mustard, pepperoncini and special dressing on Dutch Crunch.  Positives: Generous amount of meat, great bread, hefty sandwich.  Minor flaws: not enough veggies, especially the red onions and tomatoes, too much mustard, and it wasn't toasted long enough.  It was still cold in the center.  I'm sure they'll adjust this and increase the toasting time.  Or ask for it extra toasty.  Jalapenos are free.  You can add on soup, salad, chips, cookies and soft serve ice cream.  

The shop is bright and clean with a couple of tables.  The owner was really nice and would like to adjust his menu to reflect the preferences of the community.  I hope they have good meatballs.  3.5 stars for now but I bet that they will improve since they just opened.  I think adding more vegetarian options would be a smart move (e.g., egg salad, cheese) Credit cards accepted.

excerpts: PS - "One Flap Down" refers to how Jeffery Leonard from 1980's San Francisco Giants rounded the bases after hitting a home run.
one flap down.author: Michael P.
one flap down.review:
I am very excited to have a new "local" sandwich shop open in town. My first experience was extremely positive as I enjoyed the "Herb's Tribute" meatball sandwich. Being a San Francisco native, I grew up on Herb's meatball sandwiches on Taravel. The Pop's meatball sandwich is fantastic with high quality meatballs, delicious baked bread and extremely filling for my hearty appetite. 

There are many other signature sandwiches that caught my attention, so I look forward to trying and reviewing the other offerings. One big hit for sure will be the soft serve ice cream. In the pouring rain, I saw 7 people order soft serve in a 30 minute period.

Finally, I was fortunate to meet one of the owner's when I ordered my sandwich and he gave me the story behind Pop's. The shop is owned by two brothers with strong SF roots (attended Saint Ignatius and USF). It's named after their 94 year old grandfather "Pop" who is one of their great inspirations and a sandwich aficionado. 

PS - "One Flap Down" refers to how Jeffery Leonard from 1980's San Francisco Giants rounded the bases after hitting a home run.

excerpts: Hence, using Sub Center as the bar and the Atomic to compare to the One Flap Down, Pop's gets a solid 4 stars.
one flap down.author: Don O.
one flap down.review: So the one thing missing in the Portola Strip Mall was a sandwich shop.  You got a gourmet market, great dry cleaners, Creighton's (Mmmmm...Creighton's), a Starbucks, requisite liquor store, a horribly small Walgreen's, Round Table Pizza, Tower Burger and a mini mart that has some freakin yummy burritos and granted, the Tower Market makes some really good deli style sandwiches that are a pretty good deal, they don't make a toasted sub a la Submarine Center.  Hence, using Sub Center as the bar and the Atomic to compare to the One Flap Down, Pop's gets a solid 4 stars.  My partner who always orders the meatball from Sub Center says The Herb Tribute has them beat.  So since we live so close I guess when the hunger for a sub strikes we'll be seeing Pop's!  Now this is dangerous....they deliver as well!

excerpts: My friend swore by the Blazing Saddles and Free Bird but we ended up getting the Brooklyn Bridge and Twin Peaks.
The Brooklyn Bridge was good.
Liked how they toasted the rye bread.
Pastrami yummy.
But the sandwich was a little dry.
I wonder if I could get it with the Thousand Island Dressing instead to juice it up a little?
The Twin Peaks was good too.
The avocado was nice and ripe and kept that sandwich moist.
Went great with the lettuce, tomato, pepperonci, etc salad-like topping.
brooklyn bridge.author: Jean K.
brooklyn bridge.review:
Peeps up in Portola should be thanking their lucky stars to have a place like Pop's in their neighborhood. Most neighborhoods don't have a local sandwich shop this good (and I've been to all the highly rated talked about ones in the city but feel free to shoot me a line if you think I've missed one!).

Better than average sandwiches. Real solid. Not sure they're worth trekking across town for - missing a wow factor. But for your local place you can't go wrong.

My friend swore by the Blazing Saddles and Free Bird but we ended up getting the Brooklyn Bridge and Twin Peaks. The Brooklyn Bridge was good. Liked how they toasted the rye bread. Pastrami yummy. But the sandwich was a little dry. I wonder if I could get it with the Thousand Island Dressing instead to juice it up a little? The Twin Peaks was good too. The avocado was nice and ripe and kept that sandwich moist. Went great with the lettuce, tomato, pepperonci, etc salad-like topping. Dutch crunch was the way to go with that one.

I'll be looking forward to visiting this neighborhood again for the Joey Bag-a-donuts.

excerpts: I just had the "Joey Bagadonuts," which is meatballs, chicken breast, bacon, provolone, and marinara.
joey bagadonuts.author: Lester W.
joey bagadonuts.review:
I just had the "Joey Bagadonuts," which is meatballs, chicken breast, bacon, provolone, and marinara.  

Fantastic.  Why there isn't a line out the door is a mystery to me.

excerpts: Against my better judgment, I decided to order and consume in one sitting a Joey Bagadonuts (meatballs, chicken breast, bacon, provolone, and marinara sauce) sandwich.
It was very good, although it was truly big enough for two meals.
Eating the whole thing left me with no room for the complimentary Blow-Pop, either.
joey bagadonuts.author: Rick E.
joey bagadonuts.review: Against my better judgment, I decided to order and consume in one sitting a Joey Bagadonuts (meatballs, chicken breast, bacon, provolone, and marinara sauce) sandwich.  It was very good, although it was truly big enough for two meals.  Eating the whole thing left me with no room for the complimentary Blow-Pop, either.

excerpts: Good sandwiches, particularly the "Pops Special" with chicken salad.
The Tootsie Pop with each sandwich is a nice touch.
If not for their notoriously slow service, this would be a five-star review.
pops special.author: Edna T.
pops special.review: Good sandwiches, particularly the "Pops Special" with chicken salad. The Tootsie Pop with each sandwich is a nice touch. If not for their notoriously slow service, this would be a five-star review.

excerpts: Ordered the Twin Peaks on wheat roll, friend had "the GEM" (not on the website, but it's eggplant marinara sandwich) and both were so delicious.
BIG sandwich (no "small or large" bs), nicely toasted, warm meat, perfect amount of avocado... ahhhhhhhhh.
Yum.
$7 bucks total.
NiCE.
the gem.author: Christine Y.
the gem.review:
I happen to be sifting through the Valupak coupons (once a year occurrence) and saw a BOGO coupon for this place. I looked on Yelp and saw that it had decent reviews so I thought I'd go ahead and try it.

Ordered the Twin Peaks on wheat roll, friend had "the GEM" (not on the website, but it's eggplant marinara sandwich) and both were so delicious. BIG sandwich (no "small or large" bs), nicely toasted, warm meat, perfect amount of avocado... ahhhhhhhhh. Yum. $7 bucks total. NiCE. Cheap. 

We were the only ones there at 10am but they were catering an event (tons of sandwiches in big bags all over) so we did sort of wait a few minutes but the sandwich was totally worth it and staff was very friendly. 

I'm over sub center and their chaotic disorganized craziness and over-hyped salad dressing (although the three amigos are SO nice). Give this place a shot.  

Parking lot in front with meters.

Liked how they toasted the rye bread.
Pastrami yummy.
But the sandwich was a little dry.

excerpts: The Blazing Saddles is excellent.
blazing saddles.author: Cliff H.
blazing saddles.review: The Blazing Saddles is excellent. It's exactly how I like my roast beef sandwich (which I've never seen before on a menu). Roast beef with the perfect amount of horseradish, which adds a little zip and a lot of flavor. Lettuce, tomato, etc AND AVOCADO. Perfection.
